comment: Started out extremely hard but Mr Doto eased me in to a soft finish.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor. I took him for MATH 1101 and 1111. He's very thorough and has a great sense of humor. Goes very fast but will answer any questions you have in a detailed manner.

For all these people who are complaining about him going to fast, teaching older students who can't handle the math, or just not organized as well as you would like him to be, its obvious you didn't get the grade you wanted! Obviously you put more time into your review than the class work! Grow up, your in College!

Awesome! Math is not for me, however this Professor realy goes the extra length to make sure you understand the math. This is a college class, so you do have to work and study hard to make a good grade in class. Just show up and take notes, open book an notes on all tests. Great teacher!
take this teacher he is very easy and will go out of his wsy to help any students. he is the best so far at KSU

Take ONLY if you are great at math!!!  He goes at a fast past, doesn't use the book or software.  Teaches unnecessary info, doesn't follow the syllabus or schedule. A classmate tutored me through the class.

I am a math major and this guy is teaching a mandatory math class to a bunch of older students who just want it to be over with.  He teaches unnessary information to brains that can't handle it.  He is all over the place, very unorganized, and overall a terrible teacher.  He might know a lot about Math, but doesn't teach well.
Fantastic instructor. First teacher in the 3 times I've dropped this particular course to really truly help me understand the material. Thanks Mr. Doto!!
He makes math class fun for those who hate math, He is very helpful and will help you succeed.

Not helpful, goes too fast, will give you a better grade than you deserve but you don't know what he's talking about.  If you want to use this class so that you can understand what is being said in 1102 I wouldn't take him.  He doesn't answer questions very well.  I asked him questions and he wouldn't answer them with a straight answer.  It's hard!
Fast, but awesome teacher! Tests/quizzes are open note/book and he even did weekly study sessions on Sundays! Extremely helpful and not bad to look at! =P Really enjoyed a math class I was dreading!

He did move quickly, but I had him for summer.  He was a good professor and I am not a math person.  Tests were open notes and open book which was a definite plus.  He was always willing to come to class early or hold extra study sessions and offer opportunities to replace poor grades.  I would recommend him. Very laid back.

I made a B in the class. He is very laid back. Very nice. I think he's lenient when it comes to doing final grades because I thought I was going to fail but ended up with a B. You have many chances to up your grade because he'll replace test grades. Ex: Test 1-60%, Test 2-90%, he'll replace Test 1 with a 90% also. That's what he did with our class.

Like what most people say, he's a very funny young teacher. However, he does go a little fast and one if his favorites lines is "Don't worry, you'll get it, I promise it's easy." He knows the material well but he just goes so fast and considering I have a once a week class on Saturday it's kind of difficult.
Tests are open book, he is available before and after class and holds study sessions, he is EXTREMELY fair and understanding! Great Professor!!!

As a person, I liked him. As a teacher, I'm a little conflicted. He did send out pratice tests and always explained when you asked but he moved very quickly. The tests were open book but I think it was b/c none of the class could really grasp the subject. He is AWESOME with excel. I really wish that more of the class was focused on that.

Positives: Open book tests, practice tests sent out prior to actual test, funny, very nice guy; Negatives:  Goes too fast, usually is late posting info, much of what he covers is not in the book and then you are left to figure it out after class.

James is a really nice guy. Don't buy the book. He will email you practice problems and notes. You don't have to come to class, but it is recommended. CHECK YOUR EMAIL before class. He likes to send things last minute. Be prepared for some fast-paced teaching. Grades on a curve, Thank God. You will feel like quitting, but don't.
Not at all a good teacher.
Very cool prof. Tries hard to make the class fun and interesting. Very little homework, emails notes, and not much work to do.
Class was a little more challenging than most but excellent.  Prof accessible, willing to help, focuses on material that helps when you reach Calculus--a MAJOR plus!  Definitely recommend.
No Comments
